definitions.definition: a place where someone or something is located or has been put.
examples: the distress call had given the ship's position

definitions.definition: the location where someone or something should be; the correct place.
examples: the lid was put into position and screwed down

definitions.definition: a place where part of a military force is posted for strategic purposes.
examples: the guns were shelling the German positions

definitions.definition: a particular way in which someone or something is placed or arranged.
examples: he moved himself into a reclining position

definitions.definition: in a game of chess, the configuration of the pieces and pawns on the board at any point.
a particular location of the hand on the fingerboard of a stringed instrument.
examples: be familiar with the first six positions across the four strings

definitions.definition: a particular location of the slide of a trombone.
the arrangement of the constituent notes of a chord.
a situation or set of circumstances, especially one that affects one's power to act.
examples: the company's financial position is grim

definitions.definition: a job.
examples: she retired from her position as marketing director

definitions.definition: the state of being placed where one has an advantage over one's rivals in a competitive situation.
examples: his successors were already jockeying for position
synonyms: primacy; informalthe catbird seat "the two parties jockeyed for position"

definitions.definition: a person's place or rank in relation to others, especially in a competitive situation.
examples: he made up ground to finish in second position

definitions.definition: high rank or social standing.
examples: a woman of supposed wealth and position

definitions.definition: (in team games) a set of functions considered as the responsibility of a particular player based on the location in which they play.
examples: it gives every player a chance to play every fielding position

definitions.definition: a person's particular point of view or attitude toward something.
examples: I’ll never accept his position on censorship
synonyms: feelings "the government's position on the matter"

definitions.definition: an investor's net holdings in one or more markets at a particular time; the status of an individual or institutional trader's open contracts.
a proposition laid down or asserted; a tenet or assertion.
put or arrange (someone or something) in a particular place or way.
examples: he pulled out a chair and positioned it between them
synonyms: dispose; informalpark "he positioned a chair between them"

definitions.definition: promote (a product, service, or business) within a particular sector of a market, or as the fulfillment of that sector's specific requirements.
examples: a comprehensive development plan that will position the city as a major economic force in the region

definitions.definition: portray or regard (someone) as a particular type of person.
examples: I had positioned her as my antagonist
